newsitem.title: CHINA: China M2 up 21.6 percent at end-March.
newsitem.headline: China M2 up 21.6 percent at end-March.

text.p: China's broad M2 money supply was up by 21.6 percent at the end of March, State Statistical Bureau spokesman Qiu Xiaohua said on Friday. He did not specify if this was a year-on-year increase.
He said M1, or currency in circulation plus current business deposits, grew 18.9 percent at the end of March.
M0, or currency in circulation grew by 13 percent at the end of March, he said.
These growth rates were within macro-economic control boundaries, Qiu said but did not elaborate.
China has said it expects M2 to rise by 24.5 percent in 1997 while M1 was forecast to grow by about 18 percent.
China's M2 and M1 grew by 25.3 percent and 18.9 percent respectively in 1996.
M0 was up 11.6 percent last year.
